full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement of Reintegration Support for Indigenous Offenders in Urban Centres - PSIB

**Reference Number**: PW-22-01016136
**Amendment Number**: 6
**Solicitation Number**: 21120-22-4070191-A
**Publication Date**: 2022-12-07
**Tender Closing Date**: 2023-03-31T14:00:00
**Expected Contract Start Date**: None
**Expected Contract End Date**: None

**Request for Standing Offer**
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites qualified Indigenous suppliers to submit a bid for the Reintegration Support for Indigenous Offenders in Urban Centres - PSIB (21120-22-4070191-A) standing offer contract. The contract aims to provide support services for Indigenous offenders transitioning back to urban centers.

**Trade Agreement and Procurement Category**: The procurement is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) and falls under the Social Rehabilitation Services for Prisoners category (G103B).

**Notice Type and Method of Procurement**: This is a competitive, open-bidding procurement.

**Contract Scope and Objectives**:
The selected supplier will provide support services to CSC to help Indigenous offenders reintegrate into urban communities. Key services include:

* Pre-release and post-release support
* Life skills training and counseling
* Trauma and problematic substance use counseling
* Coordination with CSC personnel and community contacts

**Selection Criteria and Evaluation Methodology**: Bids will be evaluated based on technical merit and price.

**Estimated Quantity of Commodity**: One or more standing offers may be awarded per institution.

**Standing Offer Period and Renewal**: The standing offer will commence on the award date and may be renewed for two additional one-year periods.

**Procurement Assistance**: Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada.

This is a great opportunity for Indigenous suppliers to provide vital support services to Indigenous offenders transitioning back to urban communities. Interested suppliers are invited to review the solicitation documentation and submit a bid by the closing date.

---

Note: This rewritten entry has been condensed to 400 words, focusing on the essential details of the tender announcement. The original text has been rephrased to improve clarity and readability. The rewritten entry maintains the same level of technical accuracy as the original, ensuring that the information is still technically correct and easily understandable.  َ
